appDesc.description: A description of what the application does. This extension is used to...
appDesc.message: Quickly resolve digital object identifiers to their web destinations

autolinkExclusionsInfoText.description: Guidelines for entries in the autolink exclusions text(area) box
autolinkExclusionsInfoText.message:
List websites – one per line – that should not be parsed by the autolink feature. All matching tests are case-insensitive. Do not specify the protocol; http and https will be assumed.

Normal matching: Websites will be matched based on whether the string matches the beginning of the URL.
Example: example.com/abc will match http://example.com/abc/def but will not match http://www.example.com/abc/def.

Regex matching: Surround an entry by forward slashes (/) to perform a regex match on an entire URL, omitting the protocol.
Example: /(?:www\.)?example\.com\/abc(?:.+)?/ will match both http://example.com/abc/def and http://www.example.com/abc/def.

autolinkExclusionsMatch.description: Confirm that a URL is matched by one of the autolink exclusions

autolinkExclusionsNoMatch.description: Report that no match was found for the URL against the autolink exclusions

autolinkExclusionsInvalidUrl.description: Report that test URL is invalid due to missing http/https protocol

historySavedEntryLabel.description: A word to indicate an entry has been marked for save; label displayed in the datalist drop-down

historySaveInfoText.description: A description of how the save feature works on the history page
historySaveInfoText.message: DOIs marked 'Save' will not be automatically deleted when the history length is exceeded. If the history length would be exceeded by adding a new entry, the oldest non-saved entry is removed.

historySortBySave.description: Option to sort history by save status

invalidQrSizeAlert.description: A warning presented to user if the QR image size entered is too large or too small

loading.description: A temporary message while resources load

needCitationPerm.description: A notice to the user that additional permissions must be accepted for the citation generator to work
needCitationPerm.message: Citations are retrieved from crossref.org, datacite.org, and doi.org. These permissions must be accepted before the generator will function.

noCitationFound.description: A notice to the user that a citation could not be found

optionAutolink.description: A setting to enable the extension to scan every page visited by the user and convert DOI codes into clickable links.
optionAutolink.message: Automatically turn DOI codes on web pages into links

optionAutolinkExclusions.description: Label for textbox area to enter exclusions for the autolink feature

optionAutolinkInfo.description: Cautionary remarks about the autolink feature
optionAutolinkInfo.message: The autolink feature requires permission to access and modify pages you are viewing. You will need to refresh open tabs for this option to take effect.

optionAutolinkRewrite.description: A setting to enable the extension to scan every page visited by the user and rewite doi.org and dx.doi.org liks to be handled by the custom DOI resolver instead.
optionAutolinkRewrite.message: Rewrite existing doi.org and dx.doi.org links to use the Custom DOI Resolver

optionAutolinkTestExclusion.description: Label for text input to verify whether a URL will be matched by an autolink exclusion

optionContextMenu.description: A setting to enable a feature where a user can highlight a DOI on a webpage, and then right click the selected text to see a 'Resolve DOI' in the context menu

syncDataInfo.message: You must have Chrome Sync enabled for this feature to work correctly. This option should be manually enabled on each Chrome installation where you would like sync to occur. The following options are not included in sync because they require permissions to be accepted by the user before enabling: Autolink, QR title fetch.

syncDataWipeDescription.message: ↪ Wipe all synced data and disable Sync
